title: Replication
ruleIdDescription: A unique identifier for this replication rule (3-255 characters)
destinationDescription: The destination container where objects will be replicated
priorityDescription: The priority of the rule (1-999). The higher the number, the more important the priority
replicationApplicationDescription: Choose whether the rule applies to all objects or only to certain ones
replicationApplicationLimited: Limit the application of this rule
replicationApplicationForAll: Apply to all objects in the container
replicationApplicationLimitedHelper: You can limit the scope of this rule by using a prefix and/or tags
prefixDescription: Replicate only objects whose key starts with this prefix
tagsDescription: You can limit the scope of this rule to key-value pairs
useStorageClassDescription: Apply a different storage class to replicated objects
deleteMarkerReplicationDescription: Also replicate delete markers to the destination
addReplicationToastSuccessDescription: The replication rule has been created successfully.
editReplicationToastSuccessDescription: The replication rule has been modified successfully.
replicationRuleNotFound: The replication rule was not found.
tagsDisabledHelper: You cannot use tags to filter because the replication rule replicates delete markers
deleteMarkerDisabledHelper: You cannot replicate delete markers because the replication rule uses object tags to filter objects
ruleIdMinLengthError: The rule identifier must contain at least {{min}} characters
ruleIdMaxLengthError: The rule identifier cannot exceed {{max}} characters
ruleIdRegexError: The rule identifier can only contain printable ASCII characters
errorDestinationVersioningDisabled: Replication requires versioning to be enabled on the destination container
errorDestinationFetchingDetails: An error occurred while retrieving the details of the destination container
errorDestinationObjectLockDisabled: Replication requires object lock to be enabled on the destination container
noAvailableDestinationContainersAlert: To use asynchronous replication, you need another container with versioning enabled.
replicationRequiresVersioningAlert: To use asynchronous replication, versioning must be enabled.
disabledClassDestinationHelper: Select a destination container to enable this option
